questions.question: What captures 3D images?
questions.explanation: 3D scanner: captures 3D geometry. Methods: structured light, laser, photogrammetry. Uses: reverse engineering, 3D printing. Resolution: mm-level accuracy. Speed: object size dependent. Output: point clouds, CAD models.

questions.question: What provides haptic feedback?
questions.explanation: Force feedback: tactile response to actions. Uses: gaming, virtual reality, surgery simulation. Benefits: immersion, realism. Technology: actuators, motors. Challenges: latency, accuracy.

questions.question: What connects display externally?
questions.explanation: Modern connectors: carry video, power, data. USB-C: standard smartphone connector. Thunderbolt: high-speed Apple standard. Benefits: single cable multi-purpose. Speeds: 40+ Gbps modern. Backwards compatible: adapter needed sometimes.

questions.question: What outputs 3D models?
questions.explanation: 3D printer: creates physical objects layer-by-layer. Materials: plastic, resin, metal. Methods: FDM, SLA, SLS. Resolution: 0.1mm+ precision. Speed: hours typical. Applications: prototyping, manufacturing, hobbies.

questions.question: What reads QR codes?
questions.explanation: QR scanner: reads 2D barcodes. Data: encoded in grid. Uses: product info, URLs, payments. Speed: instant reading. Devices: smartphones have built-in. Error correction: damaged codes still readable.

questions.question: What records 3D models?
questions.explanation: 3D camera: captures depth information. Uses: AR/VR, gesture recognition, robotics. Technologies: structured light, time-of-flight. Accuracy: cm-level. Applications: increasing with AI/ML adoption.

questions.question: What provides wireless charging?
questions.explanation: Wireless charging: power transfer without cable. Technology: electromagnetic induction. Efficiency: ~80% typical. Devices: smartphones, tablets, watches. Standards: Qi protocol widely used.

questions.question: What converts analog to digital?
questions.explanation: ADC: converts analog signals to digital. Uses: microphone input, sensor data. Bit depth: 8/16/24 bits affects quality. Sampling rate: Hz typical. Resolution: determines accuracy. Implementation: semiconductor.

questions.question: What converts digital to analog?
questions.explanation: DAC: converts digital to analog signals. Uses: audio output, display. Bit depth: 8/16/24 bits. Sampling rate: affects quality. Quality: depends on design. Implementation: in sound cards, DACs.

questions.question: What provides joystick input?
questions.explanation: Game controller: gaming input device. Features: analog sticks, triggers, buttons. Connectivity: USB, wireless, Bluetooth. Haptics: vibration feedback. Compatibility: device specific usually. Precision: affects gameplay.
